intro: Chamaesyce sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Chamaesyce sparsiflora is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
